docs.lead_paragraph: Striving to end a cycle of crisis, congressional leaders and the White House united Tuesday behind an ambitious budget and debt deal aimed at restoring a semblance of order to Capitol Hill and ending the threat of government shutdowns and defaults until well after a new president takes office.

headline.main: No Shutdown, No Default: Congress Leaders, Obama Back Deal
headline.print_headline: No Shutdown, No Default: Congress Leaders, Obama Back Deal

docs.lead_paragraph: Consumers on Monday began shopping online for health insurance through the Affordable Care Act on a newly remodeled version of HealthCare.gov that worked more or less as promised by the government.

headline.main: Revamped HealthCare.Gov Opens With New Tools for Gauging True Cost of Insurance
headline.print_headline: Revamped HealthCare.gov Opens With New Tools for Gauging True Cost of Insurance

docs.abstract: Consumers begin using remodeled version of HeathCare.gov to shop for health insurance; website now features cost calculator and searches are listed in price order; consumers can begin purchasing plans on Nov 1.
docs.snippet: Consumers on Monday began shopping online for health insurance through the Affordable Care Act on a newly remodeled version of HealthCare.gov that worked more or less as promised by the government.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: An Annals of Internal Medicine paper reports that the money needed to treat dementia in a patient’s final five years is greater than for heart disease and cancer.

headline.main: Costs for Dementia Care Far Exceeding Other Diseases, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Dementia Is Draining Families’ Bank Accounts

docs.abstract: Study in Annals of Internal Medicine finds that for many families, cost of caring for dementia patient frequently takes almost all their household wealth; many costs for dementia patients, unlike those of cancer or heart disease patients, are not covered by Medicare.
docs.snippet: An Annals of Internal Medicine paper reports that the money needed to treat dementia in a patient’s final five years is greater than for heart disease and cancer.

docs.lead_paragraph: The accord with Republican leaders would modestly increase domestic spending over the next two years and raise the federal borrowing limit.

headline.main: Congress Strikes a Budget Deal With President
headline.print_headline: Congress Strikes a Budget Deal With President

docs.abstract: Republican leaders in Congress and Pres Obama reach tentative deal on federal budget, averting impending default by raising borrowing limit; deal, intended to settle issue before Speaker John A Boehner leaves office, includes $80 billion increase in spending over two years.
docs.snippet: The accord with Republican leaders would modestly increase domestic spending over the next two years and raise the federal borrowing limit.

byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Jackie Calmes contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: The pharmacy at the centre of suspicions over Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc's business practices began as a small pilot project two years ago and quickly grew to account for 7 percent of the drugmaker's revenue.

headline.main: From Pilot to Profit-Maker, Valeant's Pharmacy Rose Quickly
headline.print_headline: From Pilot to Profit-Maker, Valeant's Pharmacy Rose Quickly

docs.snippet: The pharmacy at the centre of suspicions over Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc's business practices began as a small pilot project two years ago and quickly grew to account for 7 percent of the drugmaker's revenue.

docs.lead_paragraph: The federal government says the cost of a benchmark plan on HealthCare.gov will increase 7.5 percent for 2016 coverage, but most people will still be able to buy a plan for less than $100 a month, after tax credits.

docs.lead_paragraph: People who live around dozens of lakes in South Carolina are under emergency orders to repair or replace dams that ruptured or were deemed unsafe by inspectors after the historic rains this month, and they face staggering bills ranging from thousands of dollars to perhaps millions.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. borrowing authority would be extended until March 2017, beyond the Obama administration, under a deal being negotiated by congressional leaders and the White House, according to a U.S. House of Representatives source.

headline.main: U.S. Debt Limit Increase Would Extend Until March 2017

headline.main: IUDs and Hormonal Implants Remain Underused Contraceptives

docs.abstract: An American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists panel has urged doctors to introduce such long-acting reversible contraceptives to women.

docs.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has ordered a review of the status of certain Palestinian neighborhoods in east Jerusalem, an official confirmed Monday, a decision that could potentially strip tens of thousands of Palestinians of their Israeli residency rights.
